name: Kniphofia
description: Kniphofia is a genus of about 70 species of flowering plants in the family Asphodelaceae, native to Africa and Middle East.Kniphofias have large, narrow, grass-like leaves and dense spikes of small, tubular flowers that bloom from early spring to autumn. When in bloom, the flowers produce an abundance of nectar, which attracts bees and butterflies. They are great garden plants, but can also be grown in pots and containers.
meaning: The genus was named in honor of Johannes Hieronymus Kniphof (1704-1763), a German botanist and physician. The common name “Red Hot Poker” refers to the red color and formation of the flowers. The name “Tritoma” usually refers to Kniphofia uvaria, though it may also be applied to the whole genus.
color_description: Kniphofia blooms in shades of red, orange, yellow and cream. These plants change color as the flower matures, which results in a bicolor look.
